Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma settled and scored 40 runs, including four fours and two sixes, after initially scoring at a strike rate of 133.
Adil Rashid took 2-0-17-0 in the first innings but recovered to take the wicket of Rohit Sharma for 57 off 39 balls.
Axar Patel took 3 wickets in his first three overs, including dismissing Jos Buttler and Moeen Ali.
Kuldeep Yadav outsmarted Harry Brook, who was dismissed trying to reverse-sweep.
England's last recognized batter, Liam Livingstone, was run-out after a mix-up with the lower order.
Pre-Game Insights: India's batters scored an above-par total on a tough pitch, and then their spinners ran through England in Providence.
England planned to shut out half of the outfield to India but weren't always successful, allowing 69 runs, including eight fours and three sixes, in the powerplay.
Post-Match Reflections: India's quest for a world title is well on course. It's been 11 years since they stood on the podium as champions.

Rohit Sharma and his men dismantled the defending champions England in the T20 World Cup 2024 semi-final, bowling them out for a mere 103 after first whacking them around to make 171 in Providence, Guyana.
Miscellaneous Highlights: On a pitch like Guyana's - where the pace was slow and the bounce was low - runs square and behind the wicket come at a premium.
England's last recognised batter, Livingstone, was run-out after a mix-up with the lower order.
